gameComponents

Class Lens

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameComponents.GameComponent
      • gameComponents.OpticalObject
        • gameComponents.RefractiveZone
          • gameComponents.Lens
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Prism

    public class Lens
extends RefractiveZone
    Virtual Optics

    This class models a lens. A lens is composed of 2 circular surfaces, so 2 circle equations are required to model it (hence the use of h1, h2, k1, k2 etc.)

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Overrides:
        refraction in class RefractiveZone

      • onSurface

        private boolean onSurface(double px,
                double py)
        Checks if a given point is on the lens or not
        Parameters:
        px - X coordinate of the tested point
        py - Y coordinate of the tested point
        Returns:
        True if the tested point is on the surface of the lens, false otherwise

      • which

        private int which(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p1,
        LineEq segment)
        Determines whether the current ray is incident on surface 1 or 2
        Parameters:
        p1 - Source end point of the incident ray
        segment - Incident ray segment
        Returns:
        1 if interacting with surface 1, 2 otherwise
